title: Introduction to Land-based Rainwater Harvesting - RUVIVAL Toolbox

subtasks: Constructing strip-cultivation rows alternating with uncultivated grass
Planting trees or crops in the adjacent basin to collect and store rainwater
Building key-line barriers perpendicular to the slope to intercept rainfall and reduce erosion
Constructing swales and living terraces as cross-slope systems for water infiltration
Creating basin systems with low-earth buns to collect and channel water to crop areas
Locating hillside barriers to collect and infiltrate water from hill slopes
Constructing sand dams or check dams across stream beds to store water and control erosion
Diverting ephemeral streams to low-lying areas for groundwater recharge and crop irrigation
Using vegetative material, stones, or soil for building barriers in rainwater harvesting systems
Improving land management to reduce soil erosion and floods
Increasing agricultural activity and food availability through sustainable water management practices
